regulations.name: Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR)
regulations.description: The FAR is the principal set of rules in the Federal Acquisition Regulation System regarding government procurement in the United States.
regulations.application: The FAR applies to the purchasing scenario as it involves procurement for a government contract, ensuring compliance with federal procurement standards.

regulations.name: Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) Regulations
regulations.description: EPA regulations are designed to protect the environment and public health by ensuring that businesses comply with environmental laws.
regulations.application: These regulations apply to the purchasing scenario if the products being procured have environmental impacts, requiring compliance with environmental standards.

regulations.name: Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) Standards
regulations.description: OSHA standards are regulations that ensure workplace safety and health.
regulations.application: These standards apply to the purchasing scenario if the products or services involve workplace safety considerations, ensuring compliance with safety regulations.

compliance_checklist: Step 1: Verify that all procurement activities comply with the Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) by reviewing the contract terms and conditions.
Step 2: Ensure that all products meet Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) standards by checking product certifications and environmental impact assessments.
Step 3: Confirm that Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) standards are met by reviewing safety data sheets and conducting a risk assessment.
